org.ensor.robots.scheduler

Class Biote

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.robots.scheduler.Biote
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetworkBiote

    public abstract class Biote
extends Object
    The Biote is the primitive implementation element in this system. A Biote has the following properties:
    • Code executed on a Biote or its derived classes is guaranteed by the system to be called from only one thread at a time. Therefore, no synchronization code is necessary in order to ensure safe operation of the Biote provided that the Biote's methods do not cross thread boundaries themselves.
    • Communication to a client can be performed through various forms of the sendTerm() function without worrying about how to route that message to the client.
    • Biote event handlers are presumed to be short-lived operations involving computation and dispatch. Methods causing direct synchronous I/O are discouraged in order to avoid blocking the Biote's other activities and ability to handle events in a timely fashion.
    Code is expected to derive from the Biote class or one of its subclasses.
    Author:
    Jon

      • Biote

        protected Biote(BioteManager aBioteManager,
     boolean useBlockingQueue)
        The constructor for a biote should never be called explicitly. To create a new biote, register the biote type using registerBioteType and then create the biote using createBiote.
        Parameters:

      • onFinalize

        protected abstract void onFinalize(Event message)
                            throws Exception
        This callback is invoked just as the biote is being destroyed. This is the biote's chance to send any final messages or release resources.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(String event,
             IEventHandler h)
        Subscribe this biote to the given event. When that event is stimulated, the given handler's process function will be called.
        Parameters:
        event - Name of event to subscribe to.
        h - Event handler to be called when the event is received.

      • unsubscribeHandlers

        public void unsubscribeHandlers(String event)
        Unsubscribe _all_ of this Biote's handlers for the given event.

      • stimulate

        public void stimulate(Event msg)
        Cause the given event to be handled immediately. This does not send the event to any other party, but instead causes all registered handlers for the event to be executed immediately.
        Parameters:
        msg -

      • getTargetBioteId

        public int getTargetBioteId(String eventName)
        Get the biote ID that the message should be sent to. If we have made a routing entry for this biote then route the message to that biote. Otherwise, the message should be routed to us.
        Parameters:
        eventName -
        Returns:

      • setMessageRoute

        public void setMessageRoute(String eventName,
                   Integer bioteId)
        For the given event name, route any messages to us directly to the given biote ID.
        Parameters:
        eventName -
        bioteId -

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(boolean immediate)
        Causes the biote to enter the terminating state. The biote will be destroyed the next time that biote gets a time slice in the event processing queue. Any events pending for the biote at the time this function is called will be lost and no opportunity will be given to handle them in the future.

      • sendStimulus

        public void sendStimulus(int bioteId,
                Event msg)
        This function is used to stimulate events to other biotes. The event is sent through the biote manager and the receiving biote places it on its event queue. The event is handled when the biote's next opportunity to handle events comes up, subject to the event processing fairness rules.
        Parameters:
        bioteId -
        msg -
        Throws:
        Exception

      • log

        public void log(boolean system,
       String message)
        This function logs a message to the smartfox log.
        Parameters:

        message -

      • log

        public void log(boolean system,
       String message,
       Atom atom)
        This function logs a message to the smartfox log along with a dump of the given atom. The message is a prefix to every line of the atom's dump.
        Parameters:
        system -
        message -
        atom -

      • __protected_friend_BioteThread__processEvents

        public void __protected_friend_BioteThread__processEvents()
        This call should only be made from a biote thread. This function processes any events queued by __protected_friend_BioteManager__enqueueStimulus() This function implements the 'fairness' rules for processing biote events and processes some number of events on a biote before yielding control back to the thread so that it can process other biotes.

      • __protected_friend_BioteManager__enqueueStimulus

        public void __protected_friend_BioteManager__enqueueStimulus(BioteManager bioteManager,
                                                    Event msg)
        This function should only be called by the biote manager during the course of a sendStimulus call. In C++, this function would be marked as protected and with a friend class of the biote manager. This function appends the given message to the biote's queue of events and schedules the biote's execution.
        Parameters:
        msg -
        Throws:
        Exception

        public void finalize()
              throws Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable
